answerText: "Lycidas"[10] This author of "Lycidas" asked "doth God exact day-labour, light denied?" in "On His Blindness." He also wrote Paradise Lost.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 3 | 6 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The speaker of this poem asks, "Where were ye Nymphs" when the title figure drowned, and it was inspired by the death of Edward King. For 10 points each: [10] Name this pastoral elegy which also casts an invective on shepherds who represent the English clergy and takes a step back from its initial speaker with the phrase "thus sang the uncouth swain."
